body.name: First Aid Only FAO-440 Outdoor First Aid Kit, 205 Pieces
body.stockDetail: Only 11 left in stock - order soon.

byLineInfo.name: Visit the First Aid Only Store

features: Outdoor Emergency First Aid Kit: Includes adhesive fabric, plastic bandages, BZK antiseptic towelettes, aspirin, and other multi-use first aid items
Convenient Packaging: This outdoor emergency kit comes in a soft-sided zippered case complete with clear plastic pockets designed to keep first aid supplies neatly organized and easy to locate
Easy Access: This convenient first aid outdoor kit makes accessing first aid supplies quick and easy
Compact Size: Perfect for hiking, camping, marine adventures, homes and cars, this outdoor trauma kit helps you stay prepared for potential emergencies

Personal and Professional First Aid Solutions: First Aid Only offers a full line of first aid kits, cabinets, and stations, Emergency Response Care, individual first aid products, Spill Clean Up kits, CPR care and more
body.description: Perfect for hiking, camping, marine adventures, home, and auto, this 205-piece First Aid Only outdoor first aid kit features all the essential first aid items you need to treat minor aches and injuries. Supplies are easy to find in the clear-pocket pages. Kit includes: first aid guide, accident report form, vinyl gloves, sunblock, lip ointment, blister prevention, insect sting relief pads, assorted bandages and gauze dressings, antiseptics, ointments including burn relief, and more.

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #249,396 in Health & Household (See Top 100 in Health & Household) #890 in First Aid Kits (Health & Household)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Industry Specific Bulk First Aid Kits When all you want or need is a first aid kit to ensure you are complying with OSHA regulations, First Aid Only has a wide selection of industry specific bulk kits to choose from. These on-the-go kits are tailored to specific industry safety concerns and come in an assortment of sizes. The bulk kits contain all the necessary first aid essentials in a variety of plastic and metal containers that can be easily stored, wall-mounted or taken anywhere.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2011
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This kit really has everything you really need.
reviews.reviewText: This kit is wonderful. It has so many useful items in it, which I believe, on what you must have at least, in every First Aid kit! I have noticed most injuries do happen outside. Maybe it's a cut, scrape, sting from an insect, etc. The kit also has contents that also apply to in-door "accidents" as well.However because their are so many items in the kit, it's hard to find the things you need for an emergency that needs to be dealt with as soon as possible. When you open the kit you will see clear pouches containing your medical contents. I suggest you organize everything neatly so it makes things easier to find. In fact, the thin cardboard shell that the kit comes covered with has a good example on how this kit should be organized with this kind of bag.Here is all the items in the kit(I am surprised none of you actually decide to let others know of all the contents...);Medicine Antiseptics;4 Aspirin tablets4 Ibuprofen tablets4 Extra-strength non-aspirin tablets12 BZK antiseptic towelettes12 Alcohol cleaning pads3 Castile soap towelettes3 Insect sting relief pads3 Antibiotic ointment packs1 Sunscreen pack2 Lip ointment packs3 First aid/burn cream packs1 Burn relief gel packBandages;50 Adhesive plastic bandages, 3/4" x 3"25 Fabric bandages, 3/4" x 3"10 Fabric bandages, 1" x 3"10 Junior adhesive plastic bandages, 3/8" x 1-1/2"4 Knuckle fabric bandages4 Fingertip fabric bandages2 Elbow & knee plastic bandages, 2" x 4"3 Butterfly wound closuresInjury Treatment;1 Instant cold compress4 Moleskin squares, 2" x 2"2 First aid tape rolls, 1/2" x 5yd.1 Finger splint, 6" x 3/4"10 Gauze dressing pads, 2" x 2"4 Gauze dressing pads, 3" x 3"2 Gauze dressing pads, 4" x 4"1 Trauma pad, 5" x 9"1 Conforming gauze roll bandage, 2"1 Sterile eye padReferences, Instruments;1 Durable, clear-pocket neon softpack with reflector stripe1 First Aid Guide1 Scissors1 Tweezers, metal2 Safety pins10 Cotton-tipped applicators, 3"2 Exam quality vinyl gloves

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2019
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for travel - the case is nice nylon quality with a durable zipper - makes packing it easy with no worries that the case will crack. The items inside are also perfect - everything you could need to get you through an emergency away from home - I really like the variety of items in this particular kit. I read some negative reviews regarding expiration dates but every single item in my kit has a future expiration date. I am extremely happy with this purchase - the price and the quality make it highly recommendable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2012
reviews.reviewText: What can I say. I was going to give this a lower rating, but I coulding. I recieved the package 2 days after I ordered it, and im all the way out in Maui. Upon recieving the package I was excited to add this to my bug out bag, only to find out there were a few missing items while I was doing inventory. It was missing the scissors, the finger splint, and the tweezers. I was pretty angry because even though those items are rather insignificant, I paid for it therefore I should recieve all the items. Anyhow, I called the customer service on the receipt, and was pleased with how helpful they were (even though it took 40 mins to get through it) I do wish though that they had American customer support, because it was hard to understand a single garbled word my rep was saying. (thus the reason it took 40 mins) but I was given a refund (minus the ungodly expensive shipping and handleing) and im happy with the product. I already had to use the cold pack cuz my mom fell and hit her head, so its useful.ProsComes with alot of helpful pieces, gauze, sunburn ointment, sunscreen, itch ointment, the basics, and great customer service.conslooked like they just threw everything in the pouch without thought or care, was missing a few items, and WAY too many bandaids (i think there were over 150 bandaids)50 large standard bandaids50 small standard bandaids10 butterfly bandaids10 knuckle bandaids10 finger bandaids10 junior bandaidsthere are like 3 more sets of 10 bandaids that I dont feel like tearing apart my bug out bag to list, but like I said an excessive amount of bandaids.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Defintely more than just band aids
reviews.reviewText: This has everything you will probably need in a typcial outing, for a good price and is very compact. It is definitely a lot more than just band aids. I wanted to get another one like the one I bought from First Aid Only about 10 years ago (Costco?) that has a blue, soft-sided case with little boxes of supplies you can reorder when you run out. It has more supplies and it is very easy to find them. I like that one better, but I can't seem to find one like it. First Aid Only, do you still make that one? Funny, every single item in that kit has a reorder number EXCEPT the full kit itself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2009
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Kit for ATV
reviews.reviewText: This is exactly the kit I was looking for to keep in my ATV. It contains a generous supply of the basics for injuries and minor wounds that might occur in remote areas. Although it contains two small rolls of medical tape, I've found that a large roll of tape sufficient to wrap sprained ankles, wrists or to bandage a puncture wound always comes in handy. Add that item. This kit is light-weight and fits perfectly into an ATV saddle bag. The flexible nylon container allows for extra items that might be desired - and the bright-orange color keeps it easily visible in the woods if you are working an emergency away from the vehicle, so you will not lose it in the leaves.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars best little kit for the money
reviews.reviewText: this is the second time I ordered this kit...it has a great variety of items with additional room to add a few things to suit your needs...the fact that it is a soft pack makes it perfect for a backpack or side door panel. and the color makes it easy to locate.
